messages.message: Hi I have a prospect who has noticed this specific PDF comes back with ‘double OCR’ on the insured name part of the document. When I run this in Instabase Enterprise (with Force OCR both on or off) this does not happen.
Thanks @Gwen - left some comments on the JIRA from initial finding and further investigation needed.
@Rakesh if we turn on object detection, does that enable force image OCR?
@hannah this is a good example where we might need to expose a few more OCR settings in build to handle edge cases like this.

Hi @Lee
No, with object detection enabled as well - it only sends specific page to OCR if there are any elements detected that need to use Form recognizer (eg: tables, multi columns etc) OR if the input is a image type. So in this case, using this doc with object detection enabled  *does* ends up using OCR.
Ok cool thanks. So the only way around this is to expose and option here in the config for Force Image OCR (or turning off all layers)

Just to clarify -- I'm pretty sure in this case with object detection turned on it forces OCR and there's no duplicate text anymore, so turning on object detection is the way to avoid the duplicated text for this file, if we want a workaround for now.

Hi Kerry
Yes correct in this case it will force OCR with object detection due to table, column like structures present. If its plain native PDF with only just text - it wont be force OCRed even with object detection enabled (this is with FR footprint reduction logic being enabled).
